publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2016-11-29 12:25:56 -0800.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: George Dornberger (1870-1934) was born in Mayfield, Santa Clara, California, and was involved in prospecting in the Yukon Territory in Alaska in late 1898 and 1899. He eventually settled in Seattle, Washington.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: Materials include two of Dornberger's diaries recording his travels to the Alaska, one cabinet photograph, and ephemera related to mining such as articles of incorporation, mining company pamphlets, a copy of the Nome Gold Digger newspaper, hand-drawn maps, stock certificates, Wells Fargo bank receipts, mining claims, and Power of Attorney affidavits. Also included is a printout of genealogical information about Dornberger and a transcription of his diaries by his descendents Betty Dornberger Westby and Dian Dornberger Murrell.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Note that material must be requested at least 36 hours in advance of intended use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [identification of item], George Dornberger papers (M2165). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While Special Collections is the owner of the physical items, permission to examine collection materials is not an authorization to publish. These materials are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study. Any transmission or reproduction beyond that allowed by fair use requires permission from the owners of rights, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/spc/using-collections/permission-publish

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Betty Dornberger Westby and Dian Dornberger Murrell; 2016. Accession MSS 2016-221.

did.unittitle: Manuscript diaries of George Dornberger's travels to theYukon, Alaska Territory: Diary 1, July 28, 1898 - March 2, 1899, and Diary 2, recopied version of Diary 1, June 21, 1898 - November 24, 1898

Ephemera: Tontine Mining Stock Exchange certificate, Tontine Mining Stock Exchange blank receipts, Tontine Mining Stock Exchange prospectus; Cape Nome descriptive pamphlet; Golden Chimney Mining Co. articles of incorporation; Wells Fargo Bank receipt of supplies purchased 1899

Documents: 3 Power of Attorney documents; Bill of Sale of enrolled-vessel, 15th of September, 1900; Quit-claim Deed, 26th of December, 1899; Territory of Alaska mining claims; Memorandum of Agreement 28th of December, 1898; 2 manuscript maps of Yukon River;
Bound for the Yukon: Grandpa George's Diary, 1898-1899, spiral bound booklet, and Family group sheet
Cabinet photo: The Deitrick Party (?), June 20, 1898
Nome Gold Digger, v. 1, no. 44, August 22, 1900. Reference to George Dornberger on p. 6
